org.lemming.processors

Class LocalExtrema.MinimumCheck<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lemming.processors.LocalExtrema.MinimumCheck<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - pixel type.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    LocalExtrema.LocalNeighborhoodCheck<net.imglib2.Point,T>
    Enclosing class:
    LocalExtrema

    public static class LocalExtrema.MinimumCheck<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements LocalExtrema.LocalNeighborhoodCheck<net.imglib2.Point,T>
    A LocalExtrema.LocalNeighborhoodCheck to test whether a pixel is a local minimum. A pixel is considered a minimum if its value is less than or equal to a specified maximum allowed value, and no pixel in the neighborhood has a smaller value. That means that minima are non-strict. Intensity plateaus may result in multiple minima.
    Author:
    Tobias Pietzsch

      • check

        public <C extends net.imglib2.Localizable & net.imglib2.Sampler<T>> net.imglib2.Point check(C center,
                                                                                            net.imglib2.algorithm.region.localneighborhood.Neighborhood<T> neighborhood)
        Description copied from interface: LocalExtrema.LocalNeighborhoodCheck
        Determine whether a pixel is a local extremum. If so, return a P that represents the maximum. Otherwise return null.
        Specified by:
        check in interface LocalExtrema.LocalNeighborhoodCheck<net.imglib2.Point,T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
        Type Parameters:
        C - - Center Type
        Parameters:
        center - an access located on the pixel to test
        neighborhood - iterable neighborhood of the pixel, not containing the pixel itself.
        Returns:
        null if the center not a local extremum, a P if it is.
